title: Vietnamese rice prices surpass Thailand’s in global markets
dc:creator: Retail Asia
description:
read the original version on: www.retailnews.asia

Vietnamese 5% broken rice, which usually costs less than its Thai peers in export markets, raced past them in October to reach record levels. It fetched $425-430 per ton, $48-51, and $18-25 higher than similar varieties from India and Thailand, according to the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development. Vietnam exported over six million tons […]

The post Vietnamese rice prices surpass Thailand’s in global markets appeared first on Retail News Asia.
